hypothesis.name: High Tilt, South-Facing
hypothesis.rationale: A high tilt angle (close to 90°) is expected to capture maximum sunlight, especially in winter months, while a south-facing azimuth (180°) optimizes exposure.

hypothesis.name: Moderate Tilt, East-Facing
hypothesis.rationale: A moderate tilt (30°) combined with an east-facing azimuth (90°) may optimize morning sunlight capture, which is beneficial for energy production.

hypothesis.name: Balanced Configuration
hypothesis.rationale: A balanced approach with a tilt of 45° and azimuth of 180° aims to optimize energy capture throughout the day, providing a good compromise.

hypothesis.name: Low Tilt, West-Facing
hypothesis.rationale: A low tilt angle (10°) with a west-facing azimuth (270°) may enhance energy production in the afternoon, capturing the sun's path effectively.

hypothesis.name: High Capacity, Optimal Tilt
hypothesis.rationale: Maximizing system capacity (20 kW) with a tilt of 60° and azimuth of 150° could leverage both high energy output and effective sunlight capture.

hypothesis.name: High Tilt, Optimal Azimuth
hypothesis.rationale: Building on the highest energy outputs, a tilt around 85° with an azimuth of 170° is expected to maximize energy capture.

hypothesis.name: Very High Tilt, South-Facing
hypothesis.rationale: Exploring a very high tilt (90°) with a south-facing azimuth (180°) could further enhance energy production, especially in winter.

hypothesis.name: High Capacity, High Tilt
hypothesis.rationale: Maximizing system capacity (20 kW) with a tilt of 88° and azimuth of 175° could leverage both high energy output and effective sunlight capture.

hypothesis.name: Moderate Tilt, East-Facing
hypothesis.rationale: Revisiting moderate tilt angles (30°) with an east-facing azimuth (90°) may still yield beneficial morning energy capture.

hypothesis.name: Exploring Low Tilt, West-Facing
hypothesis.rationale: While low tilts have performed poorly, exploring a low tilt (15°) with a west-facing azimuth (270°) may capture afternoon sunlight effectively.
